description: Replacement of 34 Metal Halide luminaires producing 350 LUX on 6 existing 15m masts by 24 LED luminaires producing 350 LUX
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plans, numbers:
- Location Plan
- EHC-ESP-01
- Towermaster Data Sheet
- Design and Access Statement, dated Oct 2022
- Technical Report, Midstream Lighting, dated 20th Nov 2023
- Lighting Diagrams, Midstream Lighting, ML2115 - HMs Description & Isolines Sheets 1-4, dated 09-11-23
- Lighting Simulation, Midstream Lighting, Rev. 06, dated 09-11-23
and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
REASON
To ensure the development complies with the provisions Hillingdon Local Plan Parts 1 (November 2012) and 2 (January 2020) and the London Plan (2021).
The floodlights hereby approved shall only be used between the hours of 09:00 - 21:30 hours Mondays to Saturdays and 09:00 - 18:00 hours on Sundays.
REASON

To protect the residential amenity of adjoining houses, to avoid disturbance to the surrounding area and to avoid negative ecological effects upon the River Pinn in accordance with Policies DMHB 11 and DMEI 7 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 - Development Management Policies (2020).

The maximum maintained lighting level should not exceed 350 Lux average when the lights are in use between the hours of 09:00 - 20:00 hours Mondays to Saturdays and 09:00 - 18:00 hours on Sundays and the maximum maintained lighting level shall not exceed 175 Lux average when the lights are in use between the hours of 20:00 - 21:30 hours Mondays to Saturdays.
REASON

To protect the residential amenity of adjoining houses, to avoid disturbance to the surrounding area and to avoid negative ecological effects upon the River Pinn in accordance with Policies DMHB 11 and DMEI 7 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 - Development Management Policies (2020).
The floodlights installed shall be the Modus S LED model.
REASON
To ensure that the impact of the lighting upon the surrounding area is minimised in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 - Development Management Policies (2020).
The intensity of light spillage from the proposed floodlights into any windows of No 30 Kings College Road should not exceed 6.5 Lux at any time.
REASON
To protect the residential amenity of No.30 Kings College Road in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 - Development Management Policies (2020).
The intensity of light spillage from the proposed floodlights measured at a distance of 50m from the pitch in any direction shall not exceed 5 lux at any time.
REASON
To protect the residential amenity of neighbouring houses in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 - Development Management Policies (2020).

Prior to the use of the floodlights in connection with sporting activities, the lighting levels, the angle and direction of the floodlights and the provision of reflectors/shields shall be checked and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Following approval, the floodlights shall be maintained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
REASON

To protect the residential amenity of adjoining houses, to avoid disturbance to the surrounding area and to avoid negative ecological effects upon the River Pinn in accordance with Policies DMHB 11 and DMEI 7 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 - Development Management Policies (2020).

Full details of a control mechanism to ensure that floodlights only operate within the permitted hours of use shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved mechanism shall be installed and operational prior to the use of the floodlights in connection with sporting activities.
REASON

To ensure that the use of the floodlights only takes place within the approved hours and to protect the amenities of local residents in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 - Development Management Policies (2020).

A notice should be permanently displayed in a prominent location on the fence around the pitch giving the name and telephone number of a person to be contacted in the event of the floodlights remaining switched on outside the approved hours of use.

The decision to GRANT planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

On this decision notice policies from the Councils Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies appear first, then relevant Local Plan Part 2 (2020), then London Plan Policies (2021). Hillingdon's Full Council adopted the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies on 8 November 2012 and the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 on 16 January 2020.
subdivision_of_building: No buildings involved, replacement luminaires on top of existing 15M masts.
